block.p: Bridgid Theresa Curry, a daughter of Anne B. Curry and Dr. Thomas A. Curry of Pottsville, Pa., was married yesterday to Amos Hargrave Presler, a son of the Rev. Jane Butterfield Presler and the Rev. Dr. Titus L. Presler of New York. The Rev. Michael Stone performed the ceremony at St. Ambrose Roman Catholic Church in Schuylkill Haven, Pa., with the bridegroom's father taking part.

The bride, 27, will keep her name. In August, she is to become a presidential management fellow and a regulatory analyst at the Environmental Protection Agency in Washington, where she will examine the effectiveness of environmental regulations. She graduated from Notre Dame and received two master's degrees from Yale, one in public health and the other in environmental management.
The couple were married Saturday at St. Ambrose Roman Catholic Church in Schuylkill Haven, Pa., with the bridegroomâ€™s father taking part.

Bridgid Theresa Curry, a daughter of Anne B. Curry and Dr. Thomas A. Curry of Pottsville, Pa., was married yesterday to Amos Hargrave Presler, a son of the Rev. Jane Butterfield Presler and the Rev. Dr. Titus L. Presler of New York. The Rev. Michael Stone performed the ceremony at St. Ambrose Roman Catholic Church in Schuylkill Haven, Pa., with the bridegroom's father taking part.

The bride, 27, will keep her name. In August, she is to become a presidential management fellow and a regulatory analyst at the Environmental Protection Agency in Washington, where she will examine the effectiveness of environmental regulations. She graduated from Notre Dame and received two master's degrees from Yale, one in public health and the other in environmental management.

Her father, a pediatrician, is a medical director in Schuylkill Haven for Blue Cross of Northeastern Pennsylvania. Her mother is the principal of St. Ambrose School, a grammar school, also in Schuylkill Haven.

The bridegroom, 25, is a researcher and consultant on public health and corporate accountability for Never Again Consulting, a company in Attleboro, Mass., that provides advice on public health litigation matters. In August, he will begin studying for a law degree at American University. He graduated from Boston University.

His mother is the interim rector at Grace Episcopal Church in White Plains. His father is the vice president for academic affairs and the professor of mission and world Christianity at General Theological Seminary in New York.
